metadata.title: CVE-2019-11745 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
When encrypting with a block cipher, if a call to NSC_EncryptUpdate wasmade with data smaller than the block size, a small out of bounds writecould occur. This could have caused heap corruption and a potentiallyexploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 68.3, FirefoxESR < 68.3, and Firefox < 71.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11745` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.8
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.8
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.8
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.16.04.8
No subscription required

firefox - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 71.0+build5-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.7.0+build1-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
